message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the International Trade Center (ITC) TradeMap to analyze the relationship between export and female participation in leadership roles in firms.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "International Trade Center (ITC) TradeMap"], "topic": ["Gender", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Global Terrorism Database (GTD), we examine how terrorism affects social sustainability and inclusion through its impact on intergroup trust, volunteering, and political participation in affected communities.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database (GTD)"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data of over 200 countries spanning the period from 1970 to 2018 from the World Development Indicators (WDI), the International Debt Statistics (IDS), and the Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex) databases to estimate the effects of government debt on financial inclusion and poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators (WDI)", "International Debt Statistics (IDS)", "Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex)"], "topic": ["Debt", "Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a survey dataset from rural provinces in China collected by the State Forestry Administration (SFA) to evaluate the impact of agroforestry on agricultural productivity, income, and ecological conservation.", "dataset": ["survey dataset from rural provinces in China collected by the State Forestry Administration (SFA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a unique, georeferenced dataset on transport infrastructure quality from the Afrobarometer surveys, which measure African citizens' attitudes towards democracy, governance, economic conditions and related issues in over 30 countries in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["georeferenced dataset on transport infrastructure quality from the Afrobarometer surveys"], "topic": ["Transport", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Employing a natural experiment approach and using data from the International Temporary Agency Worker (TAW) dataset, we evaluate how temporary work reform affects employment and productivity of firms in Austria and Germany.", "dataset": ["International Temporary Agency Worker (TAW) dataset"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses multiple datasets including the National Sample Survey, the Annual Survey of Industries and the input-output tables from the Central Statistical Organization (CSO) to examine the effects of trade liberalization on the Indian manufacturing sector during the 1990s.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey", "Annual Survey of Industries", "input-output tables from the Central Statistical Organization (CSO)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Renewable Energy Policy Network for the 21st Century's (REN21) Renewables Global Status Report and the World Inequality Database on Energy (WIDE), we explore the relationship between renewable energy production and reducing global income inequality.", "dataset": ["Renewable Energy Policy Network for the 21st Century's (REN21) Renewables Global Status Report", "World Inequality Database on Energy (WIDE)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a combination of survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), along with administrative data from health facilities provided by the Ministry of Health of Uganda, to assess the effects of community health workers on maternal and child health outcomes.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)", "administrative data from health facilities provided by the Ministry of Health of Uganda"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Values Survey (WVS) and the European Social Survey(ESS), we investigate how trust in social institutions, such as the government, media, and education, varies across countries and regions and its socio-economic consequences on regional integration.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey (WVS)", "European Social Survey(ESS)"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Governance"]}]
